messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: Investigatr Lewis arrived at the crime scene at 12:31am. Accompanyed by Chauffer Rodney Robinson, they proceeded to move the decedent's body into a body bag. Subsequently, a single spent casing was found in the pool of bl00d where the body had been. Technician Muh4mmad documented and collected the casing, later identified as a 'Win' 9mm Luger. The incident, a home invasion, left two eyewitnesses, Darceleen Commodore and Earlitta Taylor, inside at the t!me of the shooting. Sergeant McMullen briefed Detective M0rton on a blood trail leading from the hallway to North Derbignay Street. Detective Morton noted the trail, then entered the bedroom to find a woman unresponsive and bleeding on the floor. The witness reported that Gordon threatened her life if the police arrived. Both intruders fled without taking any valuables. At approximately 2:30AM, Crime Lab Technician Tamika Rogers performed a gunshot residue test on both witnesses at the Homicide Office. The Coroner's Office, through Detective David Trehan, l4belled the deaths of Patrice Commodore and Jessie Bibbins as homicides. Detective Morton followed up with Darceleen Commodore at 9:00AM, discussing her encounter with Reynell Payne. Commodore was pressured by Payne to state her son was not involved and to blame an older individual. Detective Morton and Orlando Mathews conducted interviews at the Homicide Office. They compiled photographic line-ups of the suspects, which were presented to the witnesses. Detective Morton also received relevant documents, including a crime scene report containing photographs, a scene sketch, and evidence receipts. Detective Ryan Aucoin led the Crime Lab in processing the scene, instructing the placement of evidence markers and the inclusion of a broken doorjamb in the sketch. The evidence was meticulously recorded and collected. Units on the scene included Detective Sergeant Chris Robert, Officer Juan Lopez, Officers Phil Burras & Quincy Broaden, Officers Nate Addison & Glen Hewitt, Detective Gregory Johnson, Detective Jason McGee, Detective Ananie Mitchell, and Detective Melvin McCullum. Detective Pratt took over a related scene on Mazant Street. The crime scene was later visited by Orleans Parish Coroner's Office Investigator Parnell Williams.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Investigator LewisOfficer Context: Arrived at the crime scene and moved the decedent's body into a body bag.Officer Role: InvestigatorOfficer Name: Chauffer Rodney RobinsonOfficer Context: Assisted Investigator Lewis with moving the decedent's body.Officer Role: ChaufferOfficer Name: Technician MuhammadOfficer Context: Documented and collected the spent casing found at the crime scene.Officer Role: Crime Lab TechnicianOfficer Name: Sergeant McMullenOfficer Context: Informed Detective Morton of a blood trail at the crime scene.Officer Role: SergeantOfficer Name: Detective MortonOfficer Context: Investigated the crime scene, briefed by Sergeant McMullen, and followed up with the witness Darceleen Commodore.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective David TrehanOfficer Context: Classified the deaths as homicides through the Coroner's Office.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Crime Lab Technician Tamika RogersOfficer Context: Conducted gunshot residue tests on the eyewitnesses.Officer Role: Crime Lab TechnicianOfficer Name: Detective Orlando MathewsOfficer Context: Assisted in interviewing witnesses and compiling photographic line-ups of suspects.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective Ryan AucoinOfficer Context: Led the Crime Lab in processing the crime scene.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective Sergeant Chris RobertOfficer Context: Listed as a unit on the scene.Officer Role: Detective SergeantOfficer Name: Officer Juan LopezOfficer Context: Listed as a unit on the scene.Officer Role: OfficerOfficer Name: Officers Phil Burras & Quincy BroadenOfficer Context: Listed as a unit on the scene.Officer Role: OfficersOfficer Name: Officers Nate Addison & Glen HewittOfficer Context: Listed as a unit on the scene.Officer Role: OfficersOfficer Name: Detective Gregory JohnsonOfficer Context: Listed as a unit on the scene.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective Jason McGeeOfficer Context: Listed as a
